column4: can anyone tell me why my gnome panel looks gray and lame like this screenshot: http://tinypic.com/r/1r6wjd/7   versus sexy in the images here: http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop     running ubuntu 10.10...  have tried changing gtk2 themes but the gnome panel won't change from its current look....
I just tried solving it for one person today. Its a bug. Either you're on high processor such as core i7
indeed..  I'm high on processors babeee..
and in deed I am using an nvidia card..
kill the gnome-settings-daemon and restart it
I wonder why restarting never fixed the issue if that's what it took?
hey, listen...that might be temporary because its a bug.

yeah.. the install of this machine was a pain..  the video card is rather tame nvidia in my opinion...  but I had video problems after the install (had to edit my grub config to get something going so I could fix the video modes)
maybe the next Ubuntu release will fix it. You just got to hold on to your seat for a while. :-)
and I fall into the criteria for the bug 100% (6 core i7, SSD, nvidia)
dude... it's not like I planned on restarting anytime soon.. I should be good for a while
that's how I pointed out that u got high processor and NVIDIA ;-)
